report:
**Damage Report:**

**Vehicle Make/Model:** [Insert Vehicle Information]
**Date of Inspection:** [Insert Date]

**Location of Damage:**
- The image shows a close-up view of the rear bumper area of the vehicle.

**Type of Damage:**
- There appears to be visible scratches and scuffs on the paint surface of the bumper. These scratches are linear and seem to have been caused by minor impacts or abrasions.
- The scratches are concentrated on the lower portion of the bumper, near the wheel well area.

**Additional Notes:**
- The scratches do not appear to penetrate the base coat of the paint, as the underlying color is still visible beneath the scratches.
- There are no signs of deeper dents or deformities in the metal structure of the bumper.

**Conclusion:**
The vehicle has sustained cosmetic damage in the form of scratches on the rear bumper. The damage is superficial and does not affect the structural integrity of the bumper.

**Recommendation:**
- The scratches should be repaired to restore the vehicle's appearance. This can typically be done through sanding, filling, and repainting the affected areas.

**Prepared By:**
[Your Name]  
Insurance Adjuster  
[Your Company]  
[Contact Information]  

**Date:**
[Insert Date]
